unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk exam prep apps! Are they the panacea for all our academic woes, or just another distraction in the digital age? Seriously, back in my day (ahem, '90s kids represent!), we had to actually *go* to coaching classes, write notes by hand, and burn the midnight oil with textbooks thicker than your average roti.
normalised: Okay, folks, let us talk exam prep apps! Are they the panacea for all our academic woes, or just another distraction in the digital age? Seriously, back in my day (ahem, nineties kids represent!), we had to actually *go* to coaching classes, write notes by hand, and burn the midnight oil with textbooks thicker than your average roti.

unnormalised: Now, you've got apps for everything - JEE prep, NEET coaching, even for those crazy UPSC exams. Apps like BYJU'S, Vedantu, and Unacademy seem to be everywhere. They promise personalized learning, mock tests galore, and instant doubt clearing.
normalised: Now, you have got apps for everything - J E E prep, N E E T coaching, even for those crazy U P S C exams. Apps like B Y J U apostrophe S, Vedantu, and Unacademy seem to be everywhere. They promise personalized learning, mock tests galore, and instant doubt clearing.

unnormalised: I'm wondering if these apps really work as well as they claim. Has anyone actually cracked the IIT exam using *just* an app? I mean, sure, it's convenient to study on the metro from Delhi to Gurgaon, or during your lunch break at 13:00 hrs, but does it beat the discipline of a physical classroom?
normalised: I am wondering if these apps really work as well as they claim. Has anyone actually cracked the I I T exam using *just* an app? I mean, sure, it is convenient to study on the metro from Delhi to Gurgaon, or during your lunch break at thirteen hundred hours, but does it beat the discipline of a physical classroom?

unnormalised: My cousin, Priya, is prepping for her Class 12th boards in March 2024, and she's glued to one of these apps. I worry she's spending more time swiping than studying!
normalised: My cousin, Priya, is prepping for her Class twelfth boards in March two thousand and twenty four, and she is glued to one of these apps. I worry she is spending more time swiping than studying!

unnormalised: What are your experiences? Any success stories? Any horror stories of lost progress on 25/12/2023 due to app glitches? Letâ€™s hear it! Also, any tips on how to effectively use these apps without getting completely sucked in? Maybe setting a timer for 45 minutes of studying, followed by 15 minutes of meme-scrolling? Just throwing it out there! Your insights could really help someone ace that exam on 10/05/2024.
